meanings.definition: To move in a secret or furtive manner.
meanings.sent1: He sneaked quietly past the sleeping guard.
meanings.sent2: The cat sneaked up on the unsuspecting bird.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child sneaked a cookie from the jar.
meanings.sent4: The shadows sneaked across the room as the sun set.
meanings.sent5: She sneaked through the dark alley, trying to avoid being seen.

meanings.definition: To act in a sly or underhanded way.
meanings.sent1: The fox sneaked into the henhouse to steal eggs.
meanings.sent2: He sneaked a peek at the test answers when the teacher wasn't looking.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon sneaked into the trash can for a late-night snack.
meanings.sent4: Her smile sneaked a hint of mischief as she made her secret plan.
meanings.sent5: The spy sneaked valuable information out of the enemy's headquarters.
